o jogo é legal tem boas mecânicas, e tudo mais. Porem ele não é nada receptivo a novos jogadores, a comunidade é toxica. e depois de 20 horas de jogo se você jogar meio bem, vai cair com pessoas que tem de mil a 4 mil horas. 
matchmaking simplesmente não existe. é só separado em muito novato ou muito pró, não tem meio termo. e depois dessa nova att que disseram q iam ajeitar o matchmaking só piorou.
quanto a comunidade são felizes e alegres quando conseguem pegar um killer que acabou de comprar o jogo. chingamentos e esquadrões em call sendo que cada um tem mil horas de jogo contra alguém que tem 100, 200. 
digo de novo esse jogo é bom mas não pensa nos novos jogadores.
ATT: matchmaking ficou muito pior. e a empresa ta cagando para a opnião dos players

外挂已经泛滥了，严重影响到玩家的游戏体验和游戏公平性。遇到过跑得比我电锯还快的，也遇到过跑步不留下脚印的，还有透视的怨灵。游戏内没有设有举报外挂的功能，上官网举报后审核还特别的慢。游戏本身是个好游戏，但是不希望像别的好游戏一样被外挂给毁掉，愿制作组能够重视，在过后的版本能够严惩外挂。
Plug ins have been rampant, seriously affecting the game experience and fairness of players. I've met people who run faster than my chainsaw, those who don't leave footprints when running, and the complaints of perspective. There is no report plug-in function in the game, and the audit is particularly slow after reporting on the official website. The game itself is a good game, but we don't want to be destroyed by plug-ins like other good games. The original production team can pay attention to the plug-in in in the later version.（英语渣，百度翻译而成）

This game is very fun. Either Killer or survivor, there are things to learn, mind games to be played and tilt to be had. What I will say is that this game is not new player friendly at all.

When I had just downloaded the game, I would load into rank 1 (the best ranked players) lobbies way too frequently. Also, there is a very steep skill curve involved with this game, as well has a lengthy grind to go through, as there are tons of progression to go through at the cost of bloodpoints (progression currency). A certain dedication is required if you plan on playing this game longer than one session. Another thing is the toxicity within some of the community. While I haven't personally ran into any toxic lobbies, I hear all the time that they exist quite often, so beware of that. 

While there are things for sure that need to be looked at and fixed (Perk balance, matchmaking, hitboxes etc.), it is a very fun game that, with more love, care and listening to the community from the devs, has the potential to be 10 times better than it already is.

Plus, it has Steve Harrington from Stranger Things, so that automatically makes it a 10/10.

TLDR; Dead By Daylight is a fun game but has a steep learning curve and isn't very beginner friendly. With more time put in, you learn to enjoy it. My recommendation: Wait till it is on sale, play with some friends if you can, to try and learn the ropes easier, and don't give up. The community needs more people.

最近クロスプレイが導入され、長かったマッチング時間の問題も無くなりました。
煽りも、途中抜けも少なくなってきています。同接も増えてきて、民度も高くなってきたような気がします。
運営も最近しっかり働いてくれています。感謝しましょう。
煽られた人は、「おこちゃまだなぁ」と思って、迷惑行為で報告しましょう。ゲームは楽しむものなので、怒っていてもキリがありません。とにかく今はいい状態のデットバイデイライトなので、思いっきり楽しみましょう。レビューで「無理ゲー」「クソゲーだわおもんな」とか怒っている人はただ自分が下手なだけだと思いました。以上。

I just picked up the game after the 4th anniversary, 4.0.  It's been a blast.  Tons of killers.  Great content being released.  It's a unique game, completely different play style between survivor and killer.  It can be played casually, or very competitive at top ranks.  It's been strangely addictive.

It can also be very unforgiving.  Depending on matches, you can have grossly unbalanced teams.  It's not rare to get destroyed one game by skilled players, and then bully lower ranked players in the next.  It's a hard balance to walk.  But can be daunting for new players, as the learning curve can be steep to start.  

Still.  I can't stop playing.

Dead by Daylight is the single best asymmetric multiplayer game on the market. Hands down. While the balance can waiver from time to time, both sides have access to fair and powerful tools at all times, generally speaking.
Objectives for both sides of the match are always clear-cut and easy to grasp. I need to work this generator, I need to down this survivor, I need to escape this killer. At any time, it is transparently easy to know what you need to do to get one step closer to victory. What varies is how you manage that. Can i stay on this generator right now, or is the killer nearby? If this survivor tries to vault the window, can i still hit them? If i drop the pallet now, will i have time to escape? These are just a few examples, and there's yet more to do with how Killer Powers are used, how survivors time their perk usage, item management...I could go on for hours.
On top of that, the large variety of Killers and Perks available to all players (As well as the massive pool of playable maps) help keep every game feeling fresh. Just in an hour of play i can face a team running several toolboxes trying to rush to escape as quickly as possible, a team of solo survivors with powerful individualized builds, and a team communicating with each other and using information as efficiently as possible to try and stay one step ahead. That's all without even starting on KIller powers and how much the game changes based on whether you're facing a Nurse, a Spirit, or even the occasional killer that isn't one of those.
I first bought this game in 2017 for PS4, and while i didn't exactly dislike it, i'd have been hard-pressed to say that it was a solid game. The game was riddled with unfair nonsense like pre-nerf Decisive Strike, infinite window loops, basement camping, and endless, drawn-out games thanks to players who wouldn't walk out the freaking exit door. Not to mention the sheer number of useless (almost offensive, even) perks and killers littering the game. However, after re-purchasing the game on a sale just a week or so ago, i can honestly say that all of those issues have been rectified.
Decisive Strike was nerfed to now serve as a highly effective anti-tunneling perk, infinite window loops have been straight-up removed, camping has become far less effective due to how rapidly unchecked survivors can chew through generators, and the endgame collapse has forced survivors to make a break for the exit the moment the doors open. Granted, the game is not without it's issues (Looking at you, new Matchmaking) but I'm confident that they'll be worked out step-by-step as the team at Behaviour has shown not only a willingness to hear complaints about the game, but a drive to understand the core issues behind those complaints, and a framework that allows them to consistently address the biggest problems plaguing our experiences. 
In summary, the game is balanced, refreshing, fun, and rewarding. On top of that, it's not too pricey, only setting you back 20 bucks for the base game (Which now includes a laundry list of paid DLC that became free overtime) or 60 if you want to get just about every piece of DLC up to the Spirit, and the newest killer Pyramid Head from the Silent Hill series. Even moreso, i've not yet run out of ways to shill for the folks at behaviour, but i am too lazy to type any more of them (But i will mention that the game is now Cross-Platform. Just saying). If this game is remotely interesting to you, buy it. If you have a friend who want you to play it, get them to buy it for you, and if you're not sure that it's the sort of game that appeals to you, just ask if fun games are your type of games. If you answered "Yes", buy it.


Or at least wait for the next sale.





And then buy it.
